overview_summary: All three profiled neighbors have an **unknown stance** on the development, as none has made public statements for or against it. In terms of community influence, only one (a multi-generation farm family) is rated **Medium** influence, while the others are considered **Low** influence due to lack of public roles.

neighbors.name: Wade & Tiffany Waddle
neighbors.claims: The Waddle family name has deep roots in Saline County farming, with records of a Waddle homesteader settling here in 1866 [Access Genealogy](https://accessgenealogy.com/iowa/biography-of-samuel-h-waddle.htm). Wade and Tiffany Waddle represent this long-standing local family; they farm in the area today but have not been prominent in any public development debates [Access Genealogy](https://accessgenealogy.com/iowa/biography-of-samuel-h-waddle.htm).

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect via a trusted fellow farmer or community leader. Emphasize respect for their family’s long farming heritage and explain how any project would align with preserving their land for future generations.

neighbors.name: Justin D. Jensen
neighbors.claims: Justin D. Jensen works as a sales agronomist with Nutrien Ag Solutions, advising local farmers on crop production [LinkedIn](https://clay.earth/profile/justin-jensen). His family’s Saline County land was involved in a notable 2004 property valuation dispute (filed under Richard R. Jensen and Sandra L. Jensen) against the county appraiser [FindLaw](https://caselaw.findlaw.com/ks-court-of-appeals/1418887.html).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with a data-driven discussion through an agricultural peer or extension agent. Providing clear technical and economic information about the project’s impacts will resonate given his agronomy background.

neighbors.name: Ronald A. & Sandra K. Kinkelaar
neighbors.claims: Ronald A. and Sandra K. Kinkelaar are longtime Saline County landowners residing in the rural Gypsum area (ZIP code 67448) [LocateFamily](https://www.locatefamily.com/Street-Lists/USA/KS/67448/index3.html). They have maintained a low public profile, with no record of involvement in local development controversies [LocateFamily](https://www.locatefamily.com/Street-Lists/USA/KS/67448/index3.html).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out personally through a mutual community contact. Emphasize that any project plans will respect their property rights and quiet rural lifestyle, addressing potential concerns while showing respect for their long-term stake in the land.
